Name: Trauma Resource Institute
Providing:
Free online mental health support open to the public - 1-hour meetings designed to support Southern California community.

Thursday, January 16 at 12noon 
Thursday, January 23 at 12noon
Thursday, January 30 at 12noon 

Register: https://bit.ly/UnitedForHealing
Notes:
The Trauma Resource Institute (TRI) will be hosting weekly United for Healing Gatherings. Led by Elaine Miller-Karas and Dr. Michael Sapp, these 1-hour meetings are supportive and welcoming spaces designed to help community members who have experienced the devastating impact of wildfires in Southern California. These gatherings bring together survivors, first responders, and anyone impacted by the fires led by trauma and resiliency-informed facilitators to foster healing and hope.


First meeting will be conducted in English, with Spanish translation being added to subsequent meetings.

Name: MusiCares
Providing:

- $500 grocery card

Eligibility:
Documentation of 3 years of work in music or 6 commercially released recordings or singles 


ALSO PROVIDING MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES
Virtual Groups: Thursdays from January 14 - February 18 
In-Person Groups: Thursdays from January 16 - February 20 
Details
Notes:
MusiCares is a resource to music professionals impacted by natural disasters, including the fires in the Los Angeles area. We provide short-term and long-term disaster relief related to evacuation and relocation costs, instrument replacement/repair, home damage, medical care, mental health services, & other essential living needs. Contact MusiCares to get started:**

Reach out for help: MusiCaresRelief@musicares.org  MusiCares’ expert staff treat cases with integrity and confidentiality. 

For those who have worked in the music industry for 5+ years, eligible for $1500 in financial assistance + $500 in food vouchers. Reach out to above contact information for more details.

To Qualify for Disaster Relief Fund Assistance, Members:

• Must be impacted by a natural disaster declared as an emergency by state or federal government agencies
• Must be current with SAG-AFTRA dues
• Are not eligible if they have any of the following SAG AFTRA membership statuses: Non-Member, Suspended Payment, Terminated, Resigned, or Fee Paying Non-Member (Fi-Core)
• Must be below the following liquid asset limits:

– For individuals, less than $10,000
– For applicants with spouses or dependents, less than $15,000
– Assets will be verified using recent bank statements

We are in collaboration with The Getty House Foundation, who are providing key supply donations to help as many affected Angelenos in need.

Donation packaging and distribution with The Getty House Foundation will occur after January 12th. We will be making open calls for volunteers as needed
